lines.text: Once we know the number one, we believe that we know the number two, because one plus one equals two. We forget that first we must know the meaning of plus.
Time is the substance of which I am made. Time is a river which carries me along. But I am time. It's a tiger, tearing me apart; but I am the tiger.
What is your religion?
I believe in the inspirations of conscience.
I shall calculate so that failure is impossible.
I shall fight so that failure is possible.
Everything has been said, provided words do not change their meanings, and meanings their words.
You're looking at me very strangely.
Yes.
You're waiting for me to say something to you.
Yes.
I don't know what to say. They're words I don't know. I wasn't taught them. Help me.
Impossible. Help yourself; then you will be saved. If you don't, you're as lost as the dead of Alphaville.
I... you... love. I love you.
What is the privilege of the dead?
To die no more.
What is your secret? Tell me, Mr. Caution.
Something which never changes, day or night. The past represents its future. It advances in a straight line, yet it ends by coming full circle.
No-one has ever lived in the past. No-one will ever live in the future. The present is the form of all life.
Men of your type will soon become extinct. You'll become something worse than dead. You'll become a legend.
Fuck yourself with your logic.
This isn't a bible, this is a dictionary!
Aren't they the same in the outlands?
Sometimes reality is too complex for oral communication. But legend embodies it in a form which enables it to spread all over the world.
I'm very well, thank you, you're welcome.
I refuse to become what you call normal.
Don't budge.
[He shoots]
That way I'm sure you'll keep your word.
What do you love above all?
Gold and women.
Yes, I am afraid of death. But for a humble secret agent, it's an everyday thing, like whiskey. And I've been drinking all my life.

[Internal monologue]
It's always like that. You never understand anything. Yes, it's always like that. You never understand anything. And one night, you end it in death.
And what's Alpha 60?
A giant computer, like they used to have in big business.
Nueva York... IBM...
Olivetti... General Electric... Tokyorama... Alpha 60 is one hundred and fifty light years more powerful.
I see. People have become slaves of probabilities.
The ideal here, in Alphaville is a technocracy, like that of termites and ants.
I don't understand.
Probably one hundred and fifty light years ago, one hundred and fifty two hundred, there were artist in the ant society. Yes, artists, novelists, musicians, painters. Today, no more.

Your voice, your eyes, your hands, your lips. Our silences, our words. Light that goes, light that returns. A single smile between us. In quest of knowledge, I watched the night create day while we seemed unchanged. O beloved of all, beloved of one alone, your mouth silently promised to be happy. Away, away, says hate; closer, closer, says love. A caress leads us from our infancy. Increasingly I see the human form as a lover's dialogue. The heart has but one mouth. Everything by chance. All words without thought. Sentiments adrift. Men roam the city. A glance, a word. Because I love you. Everything moves. We must advance to live. Aim straight ahead toward those you love. I went toward you, endlessly toward the light. If you smile, it enfolds me all the better. The rays of your arms pierce the mist.
The present is terrifying because it is irreversible and because it is of iron.
Time is like a circle which is endlessly described. The declining arc is the past. The inclining arc is the future.

[after shaking no]
Yes.
Something's not in orbit in the capital of this Galaxy
Her name was Beatrice. She said she was a seductress, third class. I was struck by the sadness and durability of her face.
Got a light?
I've traveled 9,000 kilometers to give it to you.
You never have love affairs?
What?
Has no one ever fallen in love with you?
In love? What's that?
Are you finished taking me for an ass? Or, are you beginning?

[Internal monologue]
Her smile and her small pointed teeth reminded me of the old vampire films - the sort they used to show at cinerama museums.
In life, one can only know the present. No one's lived in the past, or will live in the future.
Dick Tracy, is he dead?
Lemmy... conscience... Alpha 60... make... self-destruct... tenderness. Save those who weep.
Is it not obvious that someone who customarily lives in a state of suffering requires a different sort of religion from a person habitually in a state of well-being?
Before us, nothing existed here. No one. We are totally alone here. We are unique, dreadfully unique.
The meaning of words and of expressions, is no longer grasped. An isolated word, or a detail of a design can be understood. But the meaning of the whole escapes.
The acts of men carried over from past centuries will gradually destroy them logically. I, Alpha 60, am merely the logical means of this destruction.
I left because I couldn't understand a word he was saying.
But it's very simple. We learned this evening that death and life are found within the same circle.

[Internal monologue]
Natasha spoke to me in her pretty sphinx voice, pretty sphinx, pretty sphinx, pretty sphinx, pretty sphinx.
Why does everyone look so sad, somber?
You ask too many questions. Because they lack electricity.

The essence of the so-called capitalist world or the communist world, is not an evil volition to subject their people by the power of indoctrination or the power of finance; but simply the natural ambition of any organization to plan all its actions.
We must advance to live. Aim straight for those you love.
[Executed]

Listen to me, normals. We see the truth you no longer see. The truth is that the essence of man is love and faith, courage, tenderness, generosity and sacrifice. The rest is the obstacle created by the progress of your blind ignorance. One day... One day...
[Executed]
You have come from the Outlands. What were your feelings when you passed through galactic space?
The silence of infinite space appalled me.
Do you know what illuminates the night?
Poetry.
Perhaps you are a spy, Mr. Johnson.
You know I'm only a free man.
A meaningless reply.
We know nothing. We record, calculate, draw conclusions.
Sooner or later, the Outlands will declare war on us. Therefore, we decided to invade them.
What are you afraid of?
I'm afraid because I know that word without ever having seen it or read it.
Which word?
Le conscience.
La conscience.
La conscience.
In love? What's that?
This.
it's sensuality.
No, sensuality is a consequence. It cannot exist without love.
So what is love, then?
We are mastering a science so fantastic that the old American and Russian control of atomic force will seem pathetic.
Why don't you hurry up and commit suicide? We need the room for our cousin from the south.
